It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow flowers. The plant is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing drought tolerance. Its seeds are enclosed in pod-like fruits and are often dispersed by animals. Acacia gilesiana plays a role in stabilizing soils and providing habitat for local wildlife.
